Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <yorklab> TwilightPunksterToday at 3:46 PM
here sorry for the long silence people. The last few weeks have been crazy. Really crazy. A lot of secrecy and a lot of work. Some things got behind but great things are coming. Why, what, how, where, who - well, I can't really tell a lot yet. Official press releases and so on. But Komodore64 just entered the rocket to the moon. We were doing already great, but we are going beyond the madness. So since a week we have been in deep negotiations, filed some crazy paperwork. The result is that we got some serious backing. And we are talking about 78M funding for this year. So if you got KMD, RFOX or K64, hodl hodl, because great things are coming. If you have followed our Twitter, you'd know that we had Ben Fairbank as our guest to discuss the future; and the future is here. Blockchain games will go beyond anything you'd ever imagined.

[telegram] <Sam> Just so you guys know, that this was possible thanks to Ben Fairbank and RedFOX Labs who helped to seal this deal. Of course we had a lot of support from a lot of people from inside and outside the Komodo community. I am very happy when I think about the future. The future of Komodo, but also in blockchain gaming. Even though it has been crazy how fast we were able to this, and it might have been the Universe being moving in our favor. If you have been reading JL's blog, Mr.KomodoWorlds articles and following the DailyChain, KomodoPioneers, it should empower you, invigorate you, energize you to develop, invest and trade in Komodo. Soon we will release proper information through press releases, interviews and articles. We are still a small team working our butts off. But we are making some crazy moves. If you not have started working in Komodo, with Komodo or considered Komodo... the time is now. (re @yorklab: TwilightPunksterToday at 3:46 PM

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Make sure you don't have any Z funds like Pirate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> It's a bit more involved than a simple password to unlock the wallet "Once encrypted, a¬†password and timeoutvalue is required to perform certain actions, such as sending funds or exporting the private keys,¬†preventing unauthorized access¬†to your Komodo (and Komodo asset chain) funds."

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> So this encryption is definitely useful for if your laptop is stolen, or if someone uses it while you're away. They will be able to open the native wallet but any meaningful actions like sending a transaction or exporting the private keys won't work without the password

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> Litemode changed slightly so now you use a seed and encrypt the seed with a password. You can use the restore wallet button, use your seed, name the wallet, and then use a password to lock it. Then you can open your wallet by selecting the wallet name and using the password, no more copy and pasting or manually typing a seed everytime you want to login (re @EgoMV: hey guys. How to use Lite mode in new Agama 0.3.6 ?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> https://support.komodoplatform.com/support/solutions/articles/29000026360-restoring-an-address-in-agama-lite-spv-mode-with-a-wallet-seed-or-private-key (re @EgoMV: I can't find it after update to 0.3.6)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <yorklab> What's nice is that you can have several wallets with different names and the list of names are at the top of the wallet when you first open it up. You can use the restore wallet button, use your seed, name the wallet, and then use a password to lock it. Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[telegram] <TheoHx> Hello,
Please note that the integration of the new coin requires a lot of efforts, resources and time. 
There are three main conditions that the token has to meet, for us to integrate it:
It should be listed on at least one of the largest exchanges;
Market cap has to be over 5 million USD;
The daily trading volume has to be over 100 000 USD.
Since KMD coin has its own blockchain, the integration would be far more complicated than a standard ERC20 integration to implement and maintain. Therefore, it would carry an integration fee in the range of ‚Ç¨50-100k. If you are open to discussing this, please let me know.
Please note that the integration of the new coin requires a lot of efforts, resources and time, therefore, it would carry an integration fee. Let us know If you are open to discussing this.
Best Wishes,
Eva
CoinGate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
for mm2, integrating a coin costs a bit less than $50k. just add a single JSON object:
  {
    "coin": "KMD",
    "name": "komodo",
    "fname": "Komodo",
    "rpcport": 7771,
    "pubtype": 60,
    "p2shtype": 85,
    "wiftype": 188,
    "txfee": 1000,
    "mm2": 1
  },
